block.p: Jean Ellen Griffin and Sven Heinz Borho were married Friday at a house they rented in Makena, Hawaii. The Rev. Lenni K. Pokipala, a United Church of Christ minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

Mrs. Borho, 29, is an assistant vice president at Sotheby's in Manhattan, where she appraises and catalogs American books and manuscripts. She graduated cum laude from Case Western Reserve University and received a master's degree in American civilization from Brown. She is the daughter of Jane M. Griffin of Manhattan and Michael Griffin of the Bronx. Her father retired as the senior secretary for human resources at the North American Philips Corporation, the electronics company in Manhattan. Her mother is a recruiter at Hank-Kross, a placement firm in Manhattan.

Jean Ellen Griffin and Sven Heinz Borho were married Friday at a house they rented in Makena, Hawaii. The Rev. Lenni K. Pokipala, a United Church of Christ minister, performed the nondenominational ceremony.

Mrs. Borho, 29, is an assistant vice president at Sotheby's in Manhattan, where she appraises and catalogs American books and manuscripts. She graduated cum laude from Case Western Reserve University and received a master's degree in American civilization from Brown. She is the daughter of Jane M. Griffin of Manhattan and Michael Griffin of the Bronx. Her father retired as the senior secretary for human resources at the North American Philips Corporation, the electronics company in Manhattan. Her mother is a recruiter at Hank-Kross, a placement firm in Manhattan.

Mr. Borho, 33, is a partner in OrbiMed Advisors, a fund management concern in Manhattan. He graduated from Bayreuth University in Germany and received an M.B.A. degree from Western Illinois University and a master's degree in economics from the London School of Economics. He is the son of Febe and Heinz Borho of Durbach, Germany. His mother translates the Swedish edition of Burda Moden, a German fashion magazine in Offenburg, Germany. His father, who is retired, taught auto mechanics at the government vocational school in Offenburg.
